name: Root & Rebound - Reentry Legal Hotline
description: Statewide reentry legal hotline providing free legal advice and support for justice-impacted individuals, families, and service providers. Accepts collect calls from prison and jail.
eligibility_criteria: Anyone in California with reentry-related legal issues, justice-impacted individuals, families, service providers

source.name: Root & Rebound Website
source.notes: Found via Oakland reentry legal services search; major statewide reentry legal resource

name: CROP - Ready 4 Life Reentry Program
description: 12-month intensive reentry program providing tech training, supportive housing, and comprehensive wraparound services. Participants receive $1,000 monthly stipend, laptop, and credit card.
eligibility_criteria: Formerly incarcerated individuals committed to 12-month program

source.name: CROP Organization Website
source.notes: Found via Oakland reentry programs search; innovative tech-focused reentry program funded by $28.5M in state grants

name: Roots Community Health Center - Reentry Health Navigators
description: Community health center with specialized reentry services. Health Navigators are formerly incarcerated individuals who help with employment, housing, healthcare, and benefits enrollment.
eligibility_criteria: Formerly incarcerated individuals, healthcare open to all

source.name: Roots Community Health Center Website
source.notes: Found via Oakland reentry services search; employs formerly incarcerated as Health Navigators

name: Center for Employment Opportunities (CEO) - Oakland
description: Immediate employment services exclusively for people with criminal records on probation/parole. Provides transitional jobs, job readiness training, and permanent placement assistance.
eligibility_criteria: Referrals from probation and parole only, recently released from incarceration

source.name: CEO Works Website
source.notes: Found via second chance employment search; national organization with Oakland location since 2011

name: Centerforce
description: Comprehensive reentry services provider since 1977, offering continuum of care during incarceration, reentry, and after release. Expertise in jail and prison-based services.
services: Child abuse and domestic violence prevention
eligibility_criteria: Justice-impacted individuals and families in Alameda and Contra Costa Counties

source.name: Centerforce Website
source.notes: Found via Oakland reentry services search; one of Bay Area's oldest reentry organizations

name: Bay Area Legal Aid - Reentry Office Hours
description: Free legal services for reentry issues including expungement, record sealing, and other reentry-related legal barriers. Monthly walk-in office hours.
hours: Reentry Office Hours: 3rd Thursday 10am-2:30pm, General office Mon-Fri 9am-5pm
eligibility_criteria: Low-income individuals with reentry legal issues

source.name: Bay Area Legal Aid Website
source.notes: Found via Oakland expungement services search; specialized reentry legal hours

name: Oakland Private Industry Council - Breaking Through Barriers
description: Reentry employment program for young adults ages 18-35 on probation or parole. Provides work experience, job training, and permanent placement.
eligibility_criteria: Ages 18-35, on probation or parole, Oakland residents prioritized

source.name: Oakland Private Industry Council Website
source.notes: Found via second chance employment search; provides $18/hr subsidized work

name: Rubicon Programs - Center of Re-Entry Excellence (CORE) Oakland
description: One-stop comprehensive reentry center operated by Rubicon Programs for Alameda County Probation. Provides wraparound services including job training, housing, healthcare, and targeted support.
eligibility_criteria: Justice-impacted individuals in Alameda County, probation referrals prioritized, individuals within 6 months of release

source.name: Rubicon Programs CORE Website
source.notes: Found via Oakland reentry programs search; flagship Alameda County probation reentry center opened 2021

name: Asian Prisoner Support Committee - ROOTS 2 Reentry Program
description: Culturally-specific reentry program for Asian and Pacific Islander formerly incarcerated individuals. Peer-led services by formerly incarcerated staff with less than 5% recidivism rate.
services: Social services navigation (IDs, Medi-Cal, work permits)
hours: Check website for current hours and group meeting times
eligibility_criteria: Asian and Pacific Islander formerly incarcerated individuals and 'Others' in Alameda County

source.name: Asian Prisoner Support Committee Website
source.notes: Found via Oakland reentry services search; culturally-specific services since 2002, <5% recidivism

name: Asian Prisoner Support Committee - CARE Program
description: Community and Reentry Empowerment program providing support for formerly incarcerated women, transgender, and non-binary communities with culturally sensitive services.
hours: Monthly group meetings, check website for schedule
eligibility_criteria: Formerly incarcerated women, transgender, and non-binary individuals in California

source.name: Asian Prisoner Support Committee Website
source.notes: Found via Oakland reentry services search; gender-specific culturally responsive program

name: Alameda County Public Defender - Clean Slate Program
description: County-wide program helping people clean up Alameda County criminal records. Since 2013, served thousands of clients with 18,000+ petitions filed.
hours: Walk-in clinics 9am-11am on select dates (Sep 18, Oct 16, Nov 20), phone hours Mon-Fri
eligibility_criteria: Anyone with Alameda County criminal record seeking relief

source.name: Alameda County Public Defender Website
source.notes: Found via Oakland expungement search; major county-wide clean slate program since 2013

name: Berkeley Underground Scholars
description: UC Berkeley program building prison-to-school pipeline for incarcerated, formerly incarcerated, and system-impacted students. Provides holistic academic, financial, emotional, and professional support.
hours: Academic year schedule, check website for current hours
eligibility_criteria: Currently or formerly incarcerated students, system-impacted individuals, UC Berkeley students prioritized

source.name: Berkeley Underground Scholars Website
source.notes: Found via Berkeley reentry programs search; pioneering higher ed reentry program at UC Berkeley
